commitResults.messageTitle: Create skeletal version of Bubbles, that greets, echos and exits
Add the ability to store and display text entered by user
Add extra text for more personality of the chatbot
Change previous Task class to ToDoList class, shift features around
Add mark as done feature to each task
Separate tasks to todo, deadline, event tasks
Add input/output redirection technique to semi-automate testing of bot
Separate java classes by their functionality, add error handling
Change data storage of tasks from array[] to Java ArrayList
Add support for deleting tasks from the list
Use enum instead of using if-else branches in taskListener
Save tasks in the hard disk automatically when there are changes
Debug reading due/event dates for Deadline and Event from file
Add functionality for Bubbles to understand date input
Makee the code more OOP
Organize the classes into suitable java packages - bubbles
Organize tasks package to be under bubbles package
Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of the code
Add JavaDoc comments to the code (public methods)
Tweak the code to comply with a given coding standard
Give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword
Set up Gradle to allow automation of project builds using Gradle
Add a GUI to Bubbles using JavaFX technology
Edit code to comply with coding style violations after using checkStyle
Create a new Bubbles JAR file
Change JavaFX API version to resolve compile error warnings
Implement assert feature to document important assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
The program state needs to be checked at certain points to ensure
that the code is behaving as expected.

For example, assert is used in the TaskList class, to check whether the
count number that tracks the number of tasks in the tasklist is
properly decremented (when a task is deleted) or incremented (when a
new task is added).

Let's include assertions in all of the methods in TaskList, to ensure
that certain states of the task list are right and error-free.

An AssertionError with details will be thrown if the program state is
not as expected.

Assertions are used to provide more details on what went wrong when
errors are thrown (, that are visible to the author of the code).

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor to improve the code quality where necessary
commitResults.messageBody:
Code quality is needed to to guarantee understandability and
readability. This is especially crucial if the code might be passed on
to other developers, or if the code is posted to public platforms such
as Github.

For example, to reduce code duplicate, let's extract the formatting of
messages within each method in the TaskList class, and create a new
method in the Message class to deal with the functionality instead.

Furthermore, messages are extracted to be part of the Message class,
on top of the previously implemented messages.

Some methods may be longer than 30 lines of code, but it is due to the
inclusion of white space and assert.

The unsafe practices mentioned in the Code Quality guide are avoided.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use Java Streams for find command
commitResults.messageBody:
Using Streams improves on the code readability, and cuts down the
number of lines within the method for the find operation.

Let's use Streams, with the filter() and collect() methods instead
of the previous for loop to iterate through the task list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add a new remind command
commitResults.messageBody:
A new feature that reminds the user about the upcoming deadlines and
events, when the user types 'remind' in the command line of the
Bubbles bot. This feature improves on the functionality of the
task tracker bot and thus is able to help users track tasks
in a more efficient manner.

Let's generate a list of upcoming deadlines and events (happening
within a week from the time of command) and list them out to the
user.

Additional information that could be included in the remind message
includes the overdue deadlines and events, that might be included
in the next commit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove use of formatting line for messages replied by the bot
Improve GUI and set up CI with Java and Gradle
